body: Killerbee8991 I somewhat disagree dude. While it's true that we all make mistakes and should learn from them, it isn't demonstrated that she learned anything from her mistakes. She suffered zero consequences and everything ended up good for her. For all we know, she'll end up cheating again with zero pushback like she did with the other guy. She had all the reason and incentive to get back together with the black hair guy with glasses because she was literally rock bottom and he picked her up from her own filth, so that isn't a demonstration of her learning from her mistakes. She's a shitty person who did a shitty thing, AND we don't even know if she's changed due to lack of evidence.

Coomer I think she was bad for what she did, but I think the author was trying to portray the message that we all make mistakes. And the ending showed that they’ve learned there mistake from realizing It to learning the hard way. And that people can learn, and appreciate what they have. Unless the author makes a sequel we’re there still cheating, than I’ll totally agree there bad people lol
A good end it is. But honestly I don't think the girl deserve him. Idk if I'm to crude or anything but I just feel kinda bad for him (especially with the 'child'). And yeah, mom is a hoe.

How does the baby belong to the douche (ex-boyfriend/etc)? The time lapse given (top right corner of pages 6, 23, 26, 35) shows that GF met douche and fucked in August, continued fucking in September, then a year later the douche left. Just from the pictures, it really doesn't indicate that the baby's father is the douche (this is my opinion since I need translations to confirm). In fact, it doesn't even look like GF is pregnant but yea.
